content: This contribution hasn’t received enough positive votes from the community. The "REVERSE" option has therefore been deactivated.
You're gonna need to change the second type to Cylindrical instead of Circular. Since that is the shape we are dealing with here.
I like that the volume formula are provided for the understanding.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I like the idea! Not too hard, not too easy.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice and not too hard.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: like the idea.

You put Cylindrical in the description but Circular in the test cases.

Also i suggest you switch the validator and test for test 4 because the test passes with (pi = 3.1415) but the validator doesn't. Or better yet add another similar test that doesn't pass.

It's always better to have the validators be slightly more strict than the tests so you don't have stuff like 100% passing tests only to get 90% validators.

Thanks Anonymous42 for your reply : I hesitate for the right English word ...
-> If Circular is the best word : i'll change all the concerned occurrences to Circular .

The 4th test is "Mixed 2" : OK to exchange both Validator and and Test for Ide ...

If you want to round Pi to the 4th decimal, you may use 3.1416f instead of 3.1415 because the 5th digit is 9 ;-) !
=> I added the rounded suggestion for π value in constraints list.
Thanks Edjy for you interest and comment :-) !

Hi Anonymous42 !
You suggested a parallel change some days ago, and it's not a problem for me to change the 2 occurrences of this word (one in Input and the other in Constraints part), but i couldn't get yet the conviction that "Cylindrical" is better than "Circular".

When i talk about the classical pool, i use the "Rectangular" word rather than "parallelepipedic", whereas it designates the 2-d form of the pool, not the 3-d form ...
-> so i sounds odd for me to say "Rectangular" and "Cylindrical" ... Isn't it ?

=> If anyone wants to help me : please don't hesitate to Upvote (or Downote) my reply ;-) ...
Alright i see what you mean thank you for the response
